business.headline: May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

Explained: Why PNB Housing Finance Ltd shares crashed 18% todayPNB Housing Finance Ltd share crash: The steep fall followed days of weak performance. Over the past five days, the stock has lost 19.59%, and in the last month, it has dropped 26.53%.

New tax rules coming soon. How the Income Tax Bill 2025 could impact youThe new law aims to make income tax rules easier to understand, reduce legal disputes, and help people comply with tax rules more easily.

Sebi may relax IPO float norms for big firms to just 2.5% equity: ReportAt present, Sebi rules say that any company with a post-issue capital of more than Rs 1 lakh crore must offer 5% equity and raise at least Rs 5,000 crore.

ED investigates Anil Ambani in loan fraud case, summoned on August 5The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Anil Ambani for questioning on August 5 in the national capital. This is in connection with an investigation into an alleged loan fraud of Rs 12,500 crore. The development follows multiple searches the ED carried out at 35 locations in Mumbai, targeting business entities linked to the Anil Ambani group under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The probe agency's action is also based on findings from a separate investigation by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). A key point in the investigation is an alleged diversion of funds, with the transcript stating, "The development actually came after the SEBI shared with the enforcement directorate the findings of a separate probe that launched into the alleged diversion of 10,000 crore by the Reliant infrastructure."
Why has ED summoned Anil Ambani on August 5Anil Ambani, chairman and managing director of Reliance Group, has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning on August 5.
Sensex opens 168 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; HUL gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 150.77 points to 81,034.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 62.50 points to 24,705.85 as of 9:47 am.

Trump's new tariffs hit 69 nations: See who pays most and least from August 7The new order on tariffs will take effect from August 7 and will range from 10% to 41%, depending on the country, while others not mentioned in the list will face a default import duty of 10%.
ED summons Anil Ambani on August 5 amid fresh raids in Odisha, BengalAnil Ambani has been asked to appear before officials on August 5 at the ED headquarters in New Delhi.

Indian state refiners halt Russian oil imports as US threatens penalty: ReportState-run refiners in India have halted Russian oil purchases in the past week due to shrinking discounts and mounting pressure from former US President Donald Trump's threats of tariffs and sanctions.

Women's workforce participation is very low; Kalpana Viswanath, CEO SafetipinIn a powerful discussion on women's rights and safety, a call was made for systemic change over waiting for patriarchal mindsets to shift. 'We just need the right to walk safely without looking over our shoulders,' one speaker emphasised, highlighting that safety is a right, not a form of protection. The conversation revealed that women hold less than 2% of jobs in the burgeoning gig economy, a stark contrast to their participation in the traditional economy. The panel also explored how urban infrastructure and product design often have a male-as-norm bias, from the height of bus handrails to the lack of pockets in women's clothing. The dialogue touched upon the 'pink tax' in transportation, where trip-chaining results in higher travel costs for women. The need for an enabling environment, including better public transport and services, was stressed as crucial for women's economic and social participation.

Fenesta CMO Susmita Nag discusses gender bias in hiring within professional workspacesA discussion highlights the stark reality for women in India's corporate sector, where they make up only 18% of the workforce in top NSE-listed companies. A woman leader recounted her early career in the late 90s, where she was told the company 'don't hire girls' and faced a lack of basic facilities like restrooms and proper safety gear in a factory setting. Another speaker addressed the issue of tokenism on corporate boards, suggesting that having three or more women in a group forms a cohort, whereas one is mere tokenism. The conversation delved into unconscious biases in hiring, noting that women's resumes are scrutinised for marital status more often than men's. The speakers emphasised that while policies like flexi-working exist, they can lead to subtle penalties and that a fundamental mindset shift, beyond just policy changes, is crucial for true gender equity in the workplace.

ITR refund delayed? Check your status in these 2 easy waysUsually, if your return is e-verified, the refund is credited within four to five weeks. But if you're still waiting, you can easily check your refund status online.

Lead from the front: Pallavi Shroff on breaking barriers, building legaciesSpeaking at the India Today Woman Summit 2025, Pallavi S Shroff, Managing Partner, Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas said that when she began her practice in 1981, there were barely four or five women arguing cases in court.

India set to be 3rd largest economy: Minister after Trump's 'dead economy' jabThe minister's remarks come amid rising concerns over the broader implications of the US move, including potential delays to the ongoing trade deal talks and uncertainty in sectors heavily reliant on US markets.

Women had to work twice as hard: Pallavi Shroff reflects on male-dominated professionPallavi Shroff, Managing Partner at Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas & Co., spoke on her four-decade journey in a male-dominated legal profession. Shroff stated that when she began, women had to 'work twice as hard to prove that we are half as good as our male colleagues'. She recounted starting her practice in 1981, facing clients who refused to meet a woman lawyer and judges who were dismissive. A significant turning point came in 1991 when a client, for a matter in the Allahabad High Court, chartered a flight for her as she was unable to travel by train after a surgery. Shroff also discussed the challenges for women in the Indian judiciary, the existence of unconscious bias, the handling of an $11 billion deal by an all-women team, and her view that leadership means leading from the front with humility and compassion.

NSDL vs M&B Engineering vs Sri Lotus: Which one shows the best listing gains?While all three IPOs have seen investor interest, one of them appears to offer the highest possible listing gains based on current grey market premium (GMP) data.

US trade tariff blow: How much can India really lose?Analysts say the direct hit could affect over $3 billion worth of annual shipments, though the broader impact on India's GDP is expected to be limited.

US tariff of 25% puts several sectors at risk, but what's the fix?Experts said that sectors like gems and jewellery, seafood exports, and auto components are likely to feel the immediate effects of the 25% tariffs announced by the US.
Behind the delayed US-India trade deal: A standoff over farmsAt the centre of the friction is a long-standing issue that has repeatedly stalled negotiations between the two countries: agriculture.

ITR-U now open: Update your past ITR mistakes for AY 2021-22 and 2022-23The Income Tax Department has now made it possible to file updated returns (ITR-U) for Assessment Years (AY) 2021-22 and 2022-23 using the ITR-1 and ITR-2 forms. This move aims to help people fix any errors or income details they may have missed earlier.

Trump's 25% tariffs: Which sectors should brace for impact?US President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian exports starting August 1.  An additional penalty was also announced for India's continued oil purchases from Russia, which has added more uncertainty for businesses.

Explained: Why Trump's 25% tariff is a double whammy for IndiaThe move comes at a time when Indian exports are already under pressure and global demand remains uneven. It also marks a sharp deterioration in bilateral negotiations that had, until recently, appeared to be progressing toward a limited trade understanding.

Story of the crash of Flight AI 171 and a very flighty investigative reportThe Boeing 787 Dreamliner, which was on its way to London, crashed into the BJ Medical College hostel building in Ahmedabad within minutes of take-off on June 12. Who is Khalid Jamil? The man trusted to lead Indian football's revivalKhalid Jamil has been appointed head coach of the Indian men's national football team, the first Indian in the role in over ten years. His task is to revive Indian football and steer the team to better performances in upcoming tournaments.

India assistant coach reacts to Shubman Gill's unfortunate run outShubman Gill came under fire from fans for a careless run-out on Day 1 of the final Test, with India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate also highlighting the recklessness of the dismissal during the post-match media interaction.

Khalid Jamil announced as new head coach of Indian football teamFormer East Bengal and Mohun Bagan manager Khalid Jamil has been announced as new head coach of Indian football team. Jamil joins the Indian team after the exit of Manolo Marquez.

Shubman Gill's suicidal run-out was game-changer in Oval Test: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has weighed in on Shubman Gill's run-out on Day 1 of the fifth Test between India and England at The Oval, describing it as a game-changing moment that could potentially alter the course of the match.

Oval Test weather report: Will rain affect playing conditions on Day 2?India vs England: The weather played a massive role on Day 1 of the final Test match at The Oval. 6 wickets fell as India struggled to cope up with the movement in overcast conditions.

Galatasaray break Turkish transfer record to sign Victor Osimhen from NapoliGalatasaray have pulled off a stunning coup by signing Nigerian striker Victor Osimhen from Napoli in a record-breaking deal, the club confirmed on Thursday.

I had suicidal thoughts: Chahal breaks silence on divorce sagaYuzvendra Chahal has finally opened up on his divorce with Dhanashree Verma. The spinner spoke about the saga in details on a podcast, explaining his side of the story.

Saim Ayub, Nawaz star for Pakistan as West Indies' horror run continuesWest Indies' poor run in T20 Internationals continued as they slipped to their sixth consecutive defeat, going down by 14 runs against Pakistan in the opening match at Lauderhill.

Shaheen Afridi-Salman Agha controversy: Pakistan refute rift between top starsThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Thursday dismissed rumours of a rift involving pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, captain Salman Ali Agha, and head coach Mike Hesson, labelling the allegations as fabricated and defamatory.

Sunil Gavaskar, Sharad Pawar to be honoured with life-size statues at MCA museumLegendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar and veteran cricket administrator Sharad Pawar will be immortalised with life-size statues at the entrance of the upcoming Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) museum.

England seamer Woakes injured; Stokes unlikely to get replacementIndia vs England 5th Test: England will be sweating over Chris Woakes' injury going into the Day 2 of the final Test match at The Oval. Will Woakes be allowed a replacement?

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
